  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING. WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE FOR OXIDIZER AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEETS, RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025070392
item.description:
Report E-2025070392

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-03
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2025, due to a load shift, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Urethane Reducer Slow was crushed and released four (4) gallons of product, thirteen (13) 1-gallon pails of System 20 High Build Primer Gray released thirteen (13) gallons of product, and one (1) 1-gallon pail of Economy Lacquer Thinner released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the spill-impacted trailer floor and pavement below the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent granular absorbents, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails of product were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025070130
item.description:
Report X-2025070130

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that they were unloading trailer 88613 in dock door 8 when they found a pallet that had been crushed by a heavy freight bar that shifted during transit resulting in 4 oz to spill onto the floor of the trailer. ABF Supervisor states that they could smell the paint thin ner heavily once they opened the trailer. Safety advised to have close the trailer until cleaning crews arrive on scene. Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a clean up crew on emergency response to service the spill.

item.title: Report X-2025070118
item.description:
Report X-2025070118

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-27
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING GROUND PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) ONE GALLON JUGS OF OS-1 ODOR CONTROL REGULATED AS AN OXIDIZER WITH ONE LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED (2) ONE GALLON JUGS OF PROTECTION PLUS THAT DID NOT LEAK AND ARE NOT REGULATED. THERE ARE NO MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 15A7Y2, SUPPLY MASTERS, 12407 SLAUSON AVE, WHITTIER CA 90606-2833.

item.title: Report E-2025060530
item.description:
Report E-2025060530

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the site. EC personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025070003
item.description:
Report E-2025070003

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 25, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroCare (EC) to remediate the site. EC personnel utilized hand tools and granular absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 14-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060483
item.description:
Report E-2025060483

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: ST GEORGE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKY WEST AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A passenger on one of our flights had a personal spare battery go into thermal runaway in flight. The battery wrapped in a sweater. The flight was from Winnipeg, CA (YWG) to Chicago, O’Hare (ORD) scheduled departure time 14:20 hours. The crew reported that there was no detectable smoke or fire, but the battery was very hot, and the external case had split. Duration time was short. The battery was placed in the on-board fire containment bag and submerged in water without further incident. There were no reported crew or passenger injuries. The National Response Center was notified.

item.title: Report E-2025070422
item.description:
Report E-2025070422

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 12:24 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (USU about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a nail puncture from the pallet, approximately .25 gallon of ABELION BM50 (hazardous - UN2735) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor and dock. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged jug and oil-dry were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 0V650F, FARMVET PHARMACY, 1254 OLD HILLSBORO RD, FRANKLIN TN 37069-9129.
